name: QueryTimeseriesData
description:
Query and process timeseries data from multiple sources.

This tool queries timeseries data across various data sources and processes it by applying specified formulas and functions.

parameters.name: timeseries_query_payload
parameters.description: A JSON object detailing the timeseries query including formulas, query range, and resource type.

formula.description: Formula string, referencing one or more queries with their name property.

count.description: The number of results to which to limit.

limit.description:
Message for specifying limits to the number of values returned by a query.
This limit is only for scalar queries and has no effect on timeseries queries.

formulas.description: List of formulas to be calculated and returned as responses.

from.description: Start date (inclusive) of the query in milliseconds since the Unix epoch.

interval.description:
A time interval in milliseconds.
May be overridden by a larger interval if the query would result in
too many points for the specified timeframe.
Defaults to a reasonable interval for the given timeframe.

queries.description: List of queries to be run and used as inputs to the formulas.

to.description: End date (exclusive) of the query in milliseconds since the Unix epoch.

attributes.description: The object describing a timeseries formula request.

type.description: The type of the resource. The value should always be timeseries_request.

data.description: A single timeseries query to be executed.
